Description: A: Small rear- or hair-ring made of shell or bone, half broken off, one end preserved, getting thinner towards the end. B: Small pendant, made of carnelian, in the shape of a poppy seed, broken at the upper part along the perforation. C: Half a spherical glass bead, corroded to a pearlescent and white colour, originally had a pattern of swirl lines around the perforation. D: One elongated barrel-shaped bead made of white faience. E: Four dis-shaped beads made of faience, three of them white, one of the turquoise in colour.
Acquisition notes: Formerly housed by the Birmingham Museum and Art Gallery and the EES London.
